com.bmwcarit.barefoot.analysis

Class DBRCAN

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bmwcarit.barefoot.analysis.DBRCAN

  • public class DBRCAN
extends Object
    Algorithm for density-based cluster analysis of numeric data in residue classes (modulo) - DBRCAN (density-based cluster analysis in residue classes of applications with noise). This enables cluster analysis of temporal data where a time value is an integer (e.g. unix epoch time) t ∈ N and is modulo equivalent to some time τ, i.e. t ≡ τ (modulo m), within a specified time frame 0 ≤ τ < m . To give an example, analysis of day time requires m = 86400 (24h × 60min × 60s) such that unix epoch time of 1PM of any day is mapped to the same day time 3600s unix epoch time. The main feature of DBRCAN is that it finds clusters that span values across zero border, e.g. it finds clusters across midnight as with daytimes 23:57 and 00:03.

    Note: This class distinguishes two different "epsilon" parameters, i.e. maximum rounding error of floating point values and a range parameter in density based cluster analysis, which are used because of their respective reference in standard literature. For convenience, we denote ε as the maximum rounding error of floating point values, and epsilon as the range parameter in density-based cluster analysis.

    • Method Detail

      • modulo

        protected static double modulo(double dividend,
                               double divisor)
        Returns result of modulo operation with dividend and divisor.

        Note: The modulo (mod) operation is defined for positive and negative integer and floating point values:

        • 5 mod 3 = 2
        • 5 mod -3 = 2
        • 1.3 mod 0.5 = 0.3
        • 1.3 mod -0.5 = 0.3
        • -5 mod 3 = 1
        • -5 mod -3 = 1
        • -1.3 mod 0.5 = 0.2
        • -1.3 mod -0.5 = 0.2
        Parameters:
        dividend - Divident of modulo operation.
        divisor - Divisor of modulo operation.
        Returns:
        Modulo result.

      • epsilonRound

        protected static double epsilonRound(double value)
        Gets epsilon (ε) conform rounded value.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to be rounded.
        Returns:
        Epsilon conform rounded value.

      • epsilonCompare

        protected static int epsilonCompare(double left,
                                    double right)
        Epsilon (ε) conform comparison of floating point values.
        Parameters:
        left - Left value of comparison.
        right - Right value of comparison.
        Returns:
        Positive value if left is smaller, negative if left is bigger, zero otherwise.

      • moduloBetween

        protected static boolean moduloBetween(double left,
                                       double right,
                                       double value,
                                       double modulo)
        Checks if a value is between left and right border of residue class interval.
        Parameters:
        left - Left border of residue class interval.
        right - Right border of residue class interval.
        value - Value to be checked.
        modulo - Module value that defines residue class.
        Returns:
        True if value is in the interval, false otherwise.

      • cluster

        public static Set<List<Double>> cluster(List<Double> elements,
                                        double modulo,
                                        double epsilon,
                                        int minimum)
        Gets clusters of elements by density properties defined as epsilon and minimum. It considers residue class as ring of values where value 0 is right next to the value m - ε.
        Parameters:
        elements - List of floating-point values.
        modulo - Modulo value that defines the residue class.
        epsilon - Defines epsilon range (radius) to analyze density.
        minimum - Minimum number of elements within epsilon range.
        Returns:
        Set of clusters (lists) of elements.

      • bounds

        public static Tuple<Double,Double> bounds(List<Double> cluster,
                                          double modulo,
                                          double epsilon,
                                          double buffer)
        Gets left and right border (bounds) of a density cluster in a residue class of values. It considers residue class of values where value 0 is right next to the value m - ε.

        Note: A density cluster given as a list of values in a residue class is ambiguous in what is the internal of the cluster, i.e., minimum and maximum are not the respective left and right borders of the cluster. However, given the epsilon density parameter of the cluster it is unambiguous and can be determined with this function.

        Parameters:
        cluster - List of floating-point values.
        modulo - Modulo value that defines the residue class.
        epsilon - Defines epsilon range (radius) to analyze density.
        buffer - Optional buffer to be added to interval borders, zero should be used as default.
        Returns:
        Left and right border (bounds) of density cluster.

      • function

        public static List<Tuple<Double,Integer>> function(List<Double> elements,
                                                   double modulo,
                                                   double epsilon,
                                                   double buffer)
        Gets hierarchy of element clusters as by density properties defined as epsilon and minimum as a density function. Minimum is scaled logarithmic giving a logarithmic scaled hierarchy of density clusters. It considers residue class of values where value 0 is right next to the value m - ε.
        Parameters:
        elements - List of floating-point values.
        modulo - Modulo value that defines the residue class.
        epsilon - Defines epsilon range (radius) to analyze density.
        buffer - Optional buffer to be added to interval borders, zero should be used as default.
        Returns:
        Logarithmic scaled density function as step function with x value (intervals of the residue class) and y values (minimum as density parameter).
